description: A catastrophic event typically involves an unexpected occurrence with devastating physical damage, loss, or displacement of people
estimated value: The cost of a natural disaster can range from millions to billions of dollars

description: Areas directly affected by tidal changes are classified as those within 25km of a coast or 1km of a sea shore
estimated value: 12.7% of the world population lives in coastal areas

description: An urban area is defined by a high probability of being a commuting area when compared to surrounding rural and commuter areas
estimated value: 55% of the world's population lives in cities

description: An isolated area designated outside urban areas
estimated value: 45% of the world's population lives in rural areas

description: Damage to Buildings could vary from minor to complete collapse
Information will be needed to determine how many structures were damaged and estimate their value in dollars

characteristic: Rural infrastructure, E.g. Water, electricity, energy facilities
description: Damage to these will affect area residents and/or local business
The capability of the first response will depend on what type of equipment is required
Information and support will be needed for displaced people

characteristic: Number of people affected in surrounding areas
description: In some natural disaster events, people in the surrounding unscathed areas of the disaster zone will be affected due to the costs of evacuation or the possible need to evacuate if the disaster zone situation worsens
